trans-unit.source: Use Hue with Hadoop on HDInsight Linux clusters | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hue with Hadoop on HDInsight Linux clusters | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install and use Hue with Hadoop clusters on HDInsight Linux.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install and use Hue with Hadoop clusters on HDInsight Linux.

trans-unit.source: Install and use Hue on HDInsight Hadoop clusters
trans-unit.target: Install and use Hue on HDInsight Hadoop clusters

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install Hue on HDInsight Linux clusters and use tunneling to route the requests to Hue.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install Hue on HDInsight Linux clusters and use tunneling to route the requests to Hue.

trans-unit.source: What is Hue?
trans-unit.target: What is Hue?

trans-unit.source: Hue is a set of Web applications used to interact with a Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: Hue is a set of Web applications used to interact with a Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can use Hue to browse the storage associated with a Hadoop cluster (WASB, in the case of HDInsight clusters), run Hive jobs and Pig scripts, etc. The following components are supported with Hue installation on an HDInsight Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can use Hue to browse the storage associated with a Hadoop cluster (WASB, in the case of HDInsight clusters), run Hive jobs and Pig scripts, etc. The following components are supported with Hue installation on an HDInsight Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: Beeswax Hive Editor
trans-unit.target: Beeswax Hive Editor

trans-unit.source: Pig
trans-unit.target: Pig

trans-unit.source: Metastore manager
trans-unit.target: Metastore manager

trans-unit.source: Oozie
trans-unit.target: Oozie

trans-unit.source: FileBrowser (which talks to WASB default container)
trans-unit.target: FileBrowser (which talks to WASB default container)

trans-unit.source: Job Browser
trans-unit.target: Job Browser

trans-unit.source: Install Hue using Script Actions
trans-unit.target: Install Hue using Script Actions

trans-unit.source: The [https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxhueconfigactionv02/install-hue-uber-v02.sh](https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxhueconfigactionv02/install-hue-uber-v02.sh) script action is used to install Hue on an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The [https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxhueconfigactionv02/install-hue-uber-v02.sh](https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxhueconfigactionv02/install-hue-uber-v02.sh) script action is used to install Hue on an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions about how to use the script when provisioning the cluster using the Azure Classic Portal.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions about how to use the script when provisioning the cluster using the Azure Classic Portal.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also use Azure PowerShell or the HDInsight .NET SDK to create a cluster using this script.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also use Azure PowerShell or the HDInsight .NET SDK to create a cluster using this script.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using these methods, see [Customize HDInsight clusters with Script Actions](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using these methods, see [Customize HDInsight clusters with Script Actions](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Start provisioning a cluster by using the steps in [Provision HDInsight clusters on Linux](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md#portal), but do not complete provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Start provisioning a cluster by using the steps in [Provision HDInsight clusters on Linux](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md#portal), but do not complete provisioning.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To install Hue on HDInsight clusters, the recommended headnode size is at least A4 (8 cores, 14 GB memory).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To install Hue on HDInsight clusters, the recommended headnode size is at least A4 (8 cores, 14 GB memory).

trans-unit.source: On the **Optional Configuration** blade, select **Script Actions**, and provide the information as shown below:
trans-unit.target: On the **Optional Configuration** blade, select **Script Actions**, and provide the information as shown below:

trans-unit.source: ![Provide script action parameters for Hue](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/hue_script_action.png "Provide script action parameters for Hue")
trans-unit.target: ![Provide script action parameters for Hue](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/hue_script_action.png "Provide script action parameters for Hue")

trans-unit.source: __NAME__: Enter a friendly name for the script action.
trans-unit.target: __NAME__: Enter a friendly name for the script action.

trans-unit.source: __SCRIPT URI__: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxhueconfigactionv02/install-hue-uber-v02.sh
trans-unit.target: __SCRIPT URI__: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxhueconfigactionv02/install-hue-uber-v02.sh

trans-unit.source: __HEAD__: Check this option
trans-unit.target: __HEAD__: Check this option

trans-unit.source: __WORKER__: Leave this blank.
trans-unit.target: __WORKER__: Leave this blank.

trans-unit.source: __ZOOKEEPER__: Leave this blank.
trans-unit.target: __ZOOKEEPER__: Leave this blank.

trans-unit.source: __PARAMETERS__: Leave this blank.
trans-unit.target: __PARAMETERS__: Leave this blank.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the **Script Actions**, use the **Select** button to save the configuration.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the **Script Actions**, use the **Select** button to save the configuration.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use the **Select** button at the bottom of the **Optional Configuration** blade to save the optional configuration information.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use the **Select** button at the bottom of the **Optional Configuration** blade to save the optional configuration information.

trans-unit.source: Continue provisioning the cluster as described in [Provision HDInsight clusters on Linux](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md#portal).
trans-unit.target: Continue provisioning the cluster as described in [Provision HDInsight clusters on Linux](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md#portal).

trans-unit.source: Use Hue with HDInsight clusters
trans-unit.target: Use Hue with HDInsight clusters

trans-unit.source: SSH Tunneling is the only way to access Hue on the cluster once it is running.
trans-unit.target: SSH Tunneling is the only way to access Hue on the cluster once it is running.

trans-unit.source: Tunneling via SSH allows the traffic to go directly to the headnode of the cluster where Hue is running.
trans-unit.target: Tunneling via SSH allows the traffic to go directly to the headnode of the cluster where Hue is running.

trans-unit.source: After the cluster has finished provisioning, use the following steps to use Hue on an HDInsight Linux cluster.
trans-unit.target: After the cluster has finished provisioning, use the following steps to use Hue on an HDInsight Linux cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the information in [Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's](hdinsight-linux-ambari-ssh-tunnel.md) to create an SSH tunnel from your client system to the HDInsight cluster, and then configure your Web browser to use the SSH tunnel as a proxy.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in [Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's](hdinsight-linux-ambari-ssh-tunnel.md) to create an SSH tunnel from your client system to the HDInsight cluster, and then configure your Web browser to use the SSH tunnel as a proxy.

trans-unit.source: Once you have created an SSH tunnel and configured your browser to proxy traffic through it, you must find the host name of the head node.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created an SSH tunnel and configured your browser to proxy traffic through it, you must find the host name of the head node.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to get this information from Ambari:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to get this information from Ambari:

trans-unit.source: In a browser, go to https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: In a browser, go to https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, use the Admin username and password to authenticate to the site.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, use the Admin username and password to authenticate to the site.

trans-unit.source: From the menu at the top of the page, select __Hosts__.
trans-unit.target: From the menu at the top of the page, select __Hosts__.

trans-unit.source: Select the entry that begins with __hn0__.
trans-unit.target: Select the entry that begins with __hn0__.

trans-unit.source: When the page opens, the host name will be displayed at the top.
trans-unit.target: When the page opens, the host name will be displayed at the top.

trans-unit.source: The format of the host name is __hn0-CLUSTERNAME.randomcharacters.cx.internal.cloudapp.net__.
trans-unit.target: The format of the host name is __hn0-CLUSTERNAME.randomcharacters.cx.internal.cloudapp.net__.

trans-unit.source: This is the host name you must use when connecting to Hue.
trans-unit.target: This is the host name you must use when connecting to Hue.

trans-unit.source: Once you have created an SSH tunnel and configured your browser to proxy traffic through it, use the browser to open the Hue portal at http://HOSTNAME:8888.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created an SSH tunnel and configured your browser to proxy traffic through it, use the browser to open the Hue portal at http://HOSTNAME:8888.

trans-unit.source: Replace HOSTNAME with the name you obtained from Ambari in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Replace HOSTNAME with the name you obtained from Ambari in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you log in for the first time, you will be prompted to create an account to log into the Hue portal.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you log in for the first time, you will be prompted to create an account to log into the Hue portal.

trans-unit.source: The credentials you specify here will be limited to the portal and are not related to the admin or SSH user credentials you specified while provision the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The credentials you specify here will be limited to the portal and are not related to the admin or SSH user credentials you specified while provision the cluster.

trans-unit.source: ![Login to the Hue portal](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.Login.png "Specify credentials for Hue portal")
trans-unit.target: ![Login to the Hue portal](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.Login.png "Specify credentials for Hue portal")

trans-unit.source: Run a Hive query
trans-unit.target: Run a Hive query

trans-unit.source: From the Hue portal, click **Query Editors**, and then click **Hive** to open the Hive editor.
trans-unit.target: From the Hue portal, click **Query Editors**, and then click **Hive** to open the Hive editor.

trans-unit.source: ![Use Hive](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.Hive.png "Use Hive")
trans-unit.target: ![Use Hive](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.Hive.png "Use Hive")

trans-unit.source: On the **Assist** tab, under **Database**, you should see **hivesampletable**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Assist** tab, under **Database**, you should see **hivesampletable**.

trans-unit.source: This is a sample table that is shipped with all Hadoop clusters on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: This is a sample table that is shipped with all Hadoop clusters on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Enter a sample query in the right pane and see the output on the **Results** tab in the pane below, as shown in the screen capture.
trans-unit.target: Enter a sample query in the right pane and see the output on the **Results** tab in the pane below, as shown in the screen capture.

trans-unit.source: ![Run Hive query](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.Hive.Query.png "Run Hive query")
trans-unit.target: ![Run Hive query](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.Hive.Query.png "Run Hive query")

trans-unit.source: You can also use the **Chart** tab to see a visual representation of the result.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the **Chart** tab to see a visual representation of the result.

trans-unit.source: Browse the cluster storage
trans-unit.target: Browse the cluster storage

trans-unit.source: From the Hue portal, click **File Browser** in the top-right corner of the menu bar.
trans-unit.target: From the Hue portal, click **File Browser** in the top-right corner of the menu bar.

trans-unit.source: By default the file browser opens at the **/user/myuser** directory.
trans-unit.target: By default the file browser opens at the **/user/myuser** directory.

trans-unit.source: Click the forward slash right before the user directory in the path to go to the root of the Azure storage container associated with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click the forward slash right before the user directory in the path to go to the root of the Azure storage container associated with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: ![Use file browser](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.File.Browser.png "Use file browser")
trans-unit.target: ![Use file browser](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.File.Browser.png "Use file browser")

trans-unit.source: Right-click on a file or folder to see the available operations.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on a file or folder to see the available operations.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Upload** button in the right corner to upload files to the current directory.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Upload** button in the right corner to upload files to the current directory.

trans-unit.source: Use the **New** button to create new files or directories.
trans-unit.target: Use the **New** button to create new files or directories.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hue file browser can only show the contents of the default container associated with the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hue file browser can only show the contents of the default container associated with the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Any additional storage accounts/containers that you might have associated with the cluster will not be accessible using the file browser.
trans-unit.target: Any additional storage accounts/containers that you might have associated with the cluster will not be accessible using the file browser.

trans-unit.source: However, the additional containers associated with the cluster will always be accessible for the Hive jobs.
trans-unit.target: However, the additional containers associated with the cluster will always be accessible for the Hive jobs.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you enter the command `dfs -ls wasb://newcontainer@mystore.blob.core.windows.net` in the Hive editor, you can see the contents of additional containers as well.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you enter the command `dfs -ls wasb://newcontainer@mystore.blob.core.windows.net` in the Hive editor, you can see the contents of additional containers as well.

trans-unit.source: In this command, **newcontainer** is not the default container associated with a cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this command, **newcontainer** is not the default container associated with a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Important considerations
trans-unit.target: Important considerations

trans-unit.source: The script used to install Hue installs it only on Head node 0 of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The script used to install Hue installs it only on Head node 0 of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: During installation, multiple Hadoop services (HDFS, YARN, MR2, Oozie) are restarted for updating the configuration.
trans-unit.target: During installation, multiple Hadoop services (HDFS, YARN, MR2, Oozie) are restarted for updating the configuration.

trans-unit.source: After the script finishes installing Hue, it might take some time for other Hadoop services to start up.
trans-unit.target: After the script finishes installing Hue, it might take some time for other Hadoop services to start up.

trans-unit.source: This might affect Hue's performance initially.
trans-unit.target: This might affect Hue's performance initially.

trans-unit.source: Once all services start up, Hue will be fully functional.
trans-unit.target: Once all services start up, Hue will be fully functional.

trans-unit.source: Hue does not understand Tez jobs, which is the current default for Hive.
trans-unit.target: Hue does not understand Tez jobs, which is the current default for Hive.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use MapReduce as the Hive execution engine, update the script to use the following command in your script:
trans-unit.target: If you want to use MapReduce as the Hive execution engine, update the script to use the following command in your script:

trans-unit.source: With Linux clusters, you can have a scenario where your services are running on head node 0 while the Resource Manager could be running on head node 1.
trans-unit.target: With Linux clusters, you can have a scenario where your services are running on head node 0 while the Resource Manager could be running on head node 1.

trans-unit.source: Such a scenario might result in errors (shown below) when using Hue to view details of RUNNING jobs on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Such a scenario might result in errors (shown below) when using Hue to view details of RUNNING jobs on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: However, you can view the job details when the job has completed.
trans-unit.target: However, you can view the job details when the job has completed.

trans-unit.source: ![Hue portal error](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.Error.png "Hue portal error")
trans-unit.target: ![Hue portal error](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux/HDI.Hue.Portal.Error.png "Hue portal error")

trans-unit.source: This is due to a known issue.
trans-unit.target: This is due to a known issue.

trans-unit.source: As a workaround, modify Ambari so that the active Resource Manager also runs on head node 0.
trans-unit.target: As a workaround, modify Ambari so that the active Resource Manager also runs on head node 0.

trans-unit.source: Hue understands WebHDFS while HDInsight clusters use Azure Storage using `wasb://`.
trans-unit.target: Hue understands WebHDFS while HDInsight clusters use Azure Storage using `wasb://`.

trans-unit.source: So, the custom script used with script action installs WebWasb, which is a WebHDFS-compatible service for talking to WASB.
trans-unit.target: So, the custom script used with script action installs WebWasb, which is a WebHDFS-compatible service for talking to WASB.

trans-unit.source: So, even though the Hue portal says HDFS in places (like when you move your mouse over the **File Browser**), it should be interpreted as WASB.
trans-unit.target: So, even though the Hue portal says HDFS in places (like when you move your mouse over the **File Browser**), it should be interpreted as WASB.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: [Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-spark-install-linux.md) for instructions about how to use cluster customization to install and use Spark on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: [Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-spark-install-linux.md) for instructions about how to use cluster customization to install and use Spark on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Spark is an open-source parallel processing framework that supports in-memory processing to boost the performance of big data analytic applications.
trans-unit.target: Spark is an open-source parallel processing framework that supports in-memory processing to boost the performance of big data analytic applications.

trans-unit.source: [Install Giraph on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-giraph-install-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: [Install Giraph on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-giraph-install-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Giraph allows you to perform graph processing using Hadoop, and it can be used with Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Giraph allows you to perform graph processing using Hadoop, and it can be used with Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: [Install Solr on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-solr-install-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: [Install Solr on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-solr-install-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install Solr on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install Solr on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Solr allows you to perform powerful search operations on stored data.
trans-unit.target: Solr allows you to perform powerful search operations on stored data.

trans-unit.source: [Install R on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-r-scripts-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: [Install R on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-r-scripts-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: R is an open-source language and environment for statistical computing.
trans-unit.target: R is an open-source language and environment for statistical computing.

trans-unit.source: It provides hundreds of built-in statistical functions and its own programming language that combines aspects of functional and object-oriented programming.
trans-unit.target: It provides hundreds of built-in statistical functions and its own programming language that combines aspects of functional and object-oriented programming.

trans-unit.source: It also provides extensive graphical capabilities.
trans-unit.target: It also provides extensive graphical capabilities.
